lines.text:
[Caleb is helping her bring food to the table]
If you'll just follow me.
To the ends of the earth.
There were no F names in the Bible so Ma named him Frankincense because he smelled so sweet.
What do you call her?
I was thinking of some name like Hannah or Hagar or Hephzibah, picking up where your mother left off.
Hannah.
Hannah.
I got to thinking up at the cabin, about the baby. How I'd feel if someone came creeping in and carried her off. I'd string him up the nearest tree. I'd shoot him down as I would a thieving fox.
Well, Pa used to say love is kind of like the measles. You only get it once. The older you are, the tougher it goes.
Which of the boys slept in this bed, do you suppose?

[gasps]
Dorcas Galen!
What's the matter? Didn't you ever think of that; that you're sleeping in one of *their* beds?
Somehow it just don't seem fittin' for a bridegroom to spend his weddin' night in a tree.
Good morning my brothers. If you're looking for your outside clothes they're hanging up drying on the line. I came in before and got them. I couldn't get your inside clothes so I'll take them now.
Our underwear?
You're winter underwear that you're sleeping in. You might as well hand it over because you're not gonna get your clothes or food or nothing til you get all cleaned up and shaved.
Where's Adam? We wanna talk to Adam.

He's out plowing, he had his breakfast over a half an hour ago. I got hot muffins waiting, crisp bacon, steak, fryer potatoes, fresh ground coffee. Now do I get that winter underwear or do I have to come in there and take it off of you?
Don't listen to her. She wouldn't dare.
Oh wouldn't I?
Morning ma'am.
Morning backwoodsman.
Nice day for marrying.
Well, that's a right good idea.
Oh Lem, I thought you'd never ask me.

Adam, you're my eldest brother. Now I've always looked up to ya, tried to ape ya. But today I'm ashamed of you. Now I know you can lick me, lick the tar outta me! But I wouldn't hold myself no kinda man unless I showed ya how I felt!
[punches him]
Why you...!
[throws him on horse, hands him reigns]
Now, GIT!
[slaps horse]
Well, it wouldn't hurt you to learn some manners, too.
What do I need manners for? I already got me a wife.

[concerning Milly's marriage to Adam]
Oh, I think it's wonderful; love at first sight.
Alice! What kind of talk is that!

[on his wedding night]
9 o'clock an hour past your bedtime.
Yours too.
Raise your hat. What's the matter, Caleb?
My hair ain't combed.
Say something nice, Gideon.
Nice night for a coon hunt.
Smells good enough to eat.
Tastes good too, so they tell me.
Got any ketchup handy?
My stew can stand on its own feet.
Can't make no vows to a herd of cows.
Don't just stand there, do something!
What for? There's only three little ones!

[after rounding up the girls]
Now we're all fathers and we love you, so don't be afraid to answer. A ways back I heard a wee babe crying in the house. Whose is it?
[girls look at one another]
Whose is it, don't be afraid to tell?

[all at once and smiling]
Mine!
Which one is Ephraim and which is Daniel?
Me.
Y'all live around here?
Not round, here.
This is my brother Caleb.
How are you brother Caleb?
This is Milly, my wife.
Your wife? Well, I'll be a monkey's uncle! Hey Dan, he did it, he got married!

[after Millie gives birth]
I'm an uncle!
[faints]
I've always wanted to be a June Bride... and have a baby right off, in the spring maybe.
Don't you like girls?
We ain't never hardly ever seen one.

[after Dorcas hits him with a snowball]
Snowballs with rocks in them! Them poor little dears! Sobbin' buckets o' tears!

[to two women on the street]
Care for a chaw of tobaccy?
Doesn't it do anything but snow up here? We've had a blizzard every day for the past two months. I'm going crazy, shut up in this house!
Sounds like Pansy has the croup.

[to Adam]
Let me tell you something, no woman is gonna go to bear country with you to cook and wash and slave for seven slumachy back woodsmen.
When are you gonna marry me Milly?
Oh, next week Sam.
She's gonna marry me, ain't you Milly?
What would your wife say Tom?
You're beating your head against a stone wall, Milly. You'll never make jackadandies out of them!
My window!
I guess I got the beginnings.

[after the barn fight]
Frank?
Kick in the pants.
Come back, Dorcas, don't get hurt!

[attempting to get into the house to see the girls]
I got me a stiff neck.

[to Gideon]
What's the matter with you? Someone butt you in the bread basket?
in a barn!

[singing to Gideon about being in love]
How can you tell what's in its spell? How can you tell unless you've tried it? Wait for that kiss you're certain of. And let your heart decide when you're in love.

[upon seeing the Pontipee brothers arrive at the barn raising]
Who are they? I don't recall ever seeing them before.
They're strangers to me.
Seven of them.
And all as tall as church steeples.
It's Milly! Milly!
